title: Design: Technical planning for PDF manipulation features
description:
Create detailed technical design for both new features:

SHARED REQUIREMENTS:
- Refactor convert_to_pdf.py into a CLI tool with argparse
- Add new dependencies: pypdf (or PyPDF2) for PDF manipulation
- Consider reportlab or pdfplumber for text extraction

FEATURE 1 - APPEND (Simpler):
- Input: existing_pdf_path, markdown_file_path, output_path
- Steps: 1) Convert markdown to temp PDF, 2) Open existing PDF, 3) Append pages, 4) Save
- Complexity: Medium

FEATURE 2 - REPLACE BY HEADER (Complex):
- Input: existing_pdf_path, markdown_file_path, output_path, --replace-mode flag
- Steps: 1) Extract text from each PDF page, 2) Parse markdown sections by ## headers, 3) Match titles, 4) Generate new pages for matches, 5) Reconstruct PDF with replaced pages
- Challenges: Text extraction accuracy, header matching logic, page size/formatting consistency
- Complexity: High

DELIVERABLES:
- Architecture decision: which PDF libraries to use
- CLI interface design
- Implementation order (suggest: append first, then replace)

title: Feature: Replace PDF slides by matching headers
description:
Add functionality to replace specific slides in a PDF when markdown headers match slide titles. This requires:
- CLI flag (e.g., --replace-mode)
- PDF text extraction (using pdfplumber or PyMuPDF)
- Parse markdown for ## headers
- Match header text to slide titles
- Replace matched pages while preserving others
- More complex than append - requires page-level manipulation

title: Feature: Append markdown to existing PDF
description:
Add functionality to append pages from a markdown file to an existing PDF file. This requires:
- CLI argument for input PDF file
- PDF manipulation library (pypdf or PyPDF2)
- Read existing PDF, convert markdown to PDF, merge them
- Output combined PDF
